title: Valley Forge National Historical Park: Junior Ranger Day
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     For Kids     Junior Ranger Day                National Junior Ranger Day          Get Ready for Fun! Rain or Shine! It's National Junior Ranger Day at Valley Forge, and you're invited for a day of fun and excitement.   Date: April 23, 2016 Time: 10:00 am-2:00 pm Where: Start by checking in and getting your activity book at the park Visitor Center, activities are at the Visitor Center and Muhlenberg Brigade Huts. Earn Cool Rewards! Complete the Activity Book and receive a Junior Ranger badge and sticker. (The first 400 children to complete the days activities will get a special wooden centennial badge!) Stay and participate in either the noon or 2:30 pm group swearing in ceremony and receive a limited edition Centennial Junior Ranger certificate, hand signed by a real Valley Forge Ranger!      Activities Special coloring book cover Junior Ranger Book - A 2016 Junior Ranger Day exclusive! With a front cover that you can color in however you like. Find Your Park - Mark your favorite park on our giant map, and in your activity book. We sure hope you pick Valley Forge, but there's 409 other National Park Service locations to pick from!             Wildlife Watchers Help rangers look for animals in the park, and be a Citizen Scientist.             Meet a real live Continental Soldier!  Do you think you have what it took to be an American Patriot?             Log City!  Get down and dirty with hands-on activities.              Ten-Hut! Join the Continental Army.             Camp Followers Meet the women of Valley Forge.
